titlepage.subtitle:
A Collection in the
Manuscripts and Rare Books Department Mss. Sm. Coll. Kibler-Bland
titlepage.publisher: Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

defitem.label: Funding:

archdesc.runner: Special Collections, Earl Gregg Swem Library, College of William and Mary

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections, College of William and Mary
did.abstract: Typescripts of material collected and authored by J. Luther Kibler of Williamsburg concerning Richard Bland (1710-1776), composed mainly of biographical and genealogical information about Bland and his family as well as information about Henry Wetherburn and his tavern in Williamsburg, Virginia. This material concerns the dates of 1671-1776 although the typescripts are not from that era.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to all researchers.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights/ Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Before publishing quotations or excerpts from any materials, permission must be obtained from the Curator of Manuscripts and Rare Books, and the holder of the copyright, if not Swem Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Kibler-Bland Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: Typescripts of material concerning Richard Bland, (1710-1776), of Williamsburg, Virginia composed mainly of biographical and genealogical information on Bland and his family and information about the Bland House in Williamsburg, Virginia. Also included, biographical material on Henry Wetherburn in connection with running his tavern in Wiliiamsburg. This material concerns the dates of 1671-1776 although the typescripts are not from that era.
The typescripts of the articles and notes on the subject of the Richard Bland House were authored by J. Luther Kibler.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Materials related to this collection can be found under the J. Luther Kibler Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary.

p.archref:
J. Luther Kibler Papers, Manuscripts and Rare Books Department, Swem Library, College of William and Mary, Williamsburg, Virginia. J. Luther Kibler Papers, 1908-1944.
1,008 items. Collection number: Mss. 65 K53.

scopecontent.p: Donor's record consists of an envelope which was used to store and collect these materials.
